title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Local Government Act 2001
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Local Government Act 2001 

(Section 237A) (Amendment) Regulations, 2024.

heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 14 June 2024.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 14 June 2024.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: In these Regulations,
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, 

“Principal Regulations” means the Local Government Act 2001 (Section 
237A) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 274/2003). 

Amendment of Article 3(2) of Principal Regulations
text_norm: 3 regulation principal regulation mean local government act 2001 (section 237a) regulation 2003 (s.i no 274 2003) amendment article 3(2) principal regulation

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: 4. Article 3(2) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the inclusion
text_raw:
4. Article 3(2) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the inclusion 

of: 

“Act of 2024” means the Local Government (Mayor of Limerick) and 
Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2024 (No. 7 of 2024); 

“chief executive” has the meaning assigned to it by section 144 of the Local 
Government Act of 2001 (as amended by section 54 of the Local Government 
Reform Act of 2014) and shall, in the case of Limerick City and County 
Council, be read as “director general”; 

“director general” has the meaning assigned to it by section 26 of the Act of
text_norm: 4 article 3(2) principal regulation amended inclusion act 2024 mean local government (mayor limerick) miscellaneous provision act 2024 (no 7 2024) chief executive meaning assigned section 144 local government act 2001 (as amended section 54 local government reform act 2014) shall case limerick city county council read director general director general meaning assigned section 26 act

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: 2024. “Limerick City and County Council” shall be construed as in accordance
text_raw:
2024. “Limerick City and County Council” shall be construed as in accordance 
with subsection (3) of section 11 of, and Part 3 of Schedule 5 to, the Local 
Government Act of 2001; 

“Mayor” has the meaning assigned to it by section 9 of the Act of 2024; 

 “cathaoirleach” shall, in the case of Limerick City and County Council, be 
read as “príomh comhairleoir”; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 31st May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [257] 3 

“príomh comhairleoir” has the meaning assigned to it by section 22 of the Act 
of 2024; and, 

“director general” has the meaning assigned to it by section 26 of the Act of
text_norm: 2024 limerick city county council shall construed accordance subsection (3) section 11 part 3 schedule 5 local government act 2001 mayor meaning assigned section 9 act 2024 cathaoirleach shall case limerick city county council read priomh comhairleoir notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 31st may 2024 257 3 priomh comhairleoir meaning assigned section 22 act 2024 director general meaning assigned section 26 act

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: Amendment of Article 12 of Principal Regulations
text_raw:
2024.” 

Amendment of Article 12 of Principal Regulations

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: 5. Article 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
5. Article 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following: 

“A chief executive, together with the cathaoirleach of the county council or 
city council, and, in the case of Limerick City and County Council, the Mayor, 
shall arrange to meet with local parliamentary representatives as a group at 
least annually.” 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 29 May 2024 

ALAN DILLON 
 Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local 

Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [257]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), and the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Local Government Act 2001 (Section 237A) 
Regulations 2003 to take account of the enactment of the Local Government 
(Mayor of Limerick) and Miscellaneous Provisions Act (No.7 of 2024). 

 
 
 
 
 
 [257] 5
